questions.question: When parking uphill on a two-way street with no curbs, your front wheels should be:
choices: Parallel with the street
Turned to the left (toward the street)
Turned to the right (away from the street)

questions.question: After a conviction of illegally passing a stopped school bus, penalties include:
choices: Suspension of your driving privilege for six months
A fine of $150 for a first conviction
A reinstatement fee of $150 for a first conviction

questions.question: True or false? If you have a tire blowout, you should immediately apply the brakes and quickly pull off the roadway
choices: False
True

questions.question: You are turning onto a two-lane road divided by a broken yellow line. You know immediately that:
choices: That you are entering a work zone
You are on a two-way road
You are on a one-way road

questions.question: If red lights are flashing and gates are closing at a railroad crossing, you should:
choices: Speed up and pass the crossing before the gates close
Stop and wait until the gates close. If no train is approaching, drive carefully around the gates
Stop and remain stopped until the gates open and the red lights have stopped flashing

questions.question: When you keep a three-second following distance to the car ahead, you always have enough space to stop safely.
choices: False
True

questions.question: If you encounter an aggressive driver on the road:
choices: Honk your horn
Get out of the way
Flash your headlights

questions.question: Vehicles in a roundabout always travel in one direction.
choices: True
False

questions.question: True or false? A minor must appear in court with a parent/legal guardian to obtain court supervision for a traffic violation.
choices: False
True

questions.question: Which lane should you use for a left turn?
choices: Lane B with flashing yellow arrow
Lane C with steady green arrow
Lane A with steady red X

questions.question: You must obey signals and directions from school crossing guards:
choices: Only when you see children close by
Only during school hours
At all times

questions.question: Rear-facing infant seats should:
choices: Be placed in the front seat
Be placed in the back seat

questions.question: When driving in fog, it is not advisable to:
choices: Increase your following distance
Slow down
Drive with your cruise control

questions.question: When making a left or right turn in a business or residential district, you should start using your turn signal:
choices: At least 100 feet before the turn
About 50 feet before the turn
Not until you actually start turning

questions.question: Why should you pay close attention to a truck's turn signals when it turns?
choices: The truck often appears to be turning in the other direction
The turn signals tell you that it is safe to pass
The turn signals may not work properly

questions.question: Which statement is true about motorcyclists and other roadway users?
choices: Motorcyclists are not allowed to drive faster than motorists in congested traffic.
They have the same rights and responsibilities
Motorcyclists are less affected by wind and rain

questions.question: The ability to stop your car safely depends on:
choices: Vehicle weight
Posted speed limit
In which direction you are driving

questions.question: You are driving on an interstate posted for 65 mph. Around you, traffic is traveling at 70 mph. What should your speed be?
choices: 70 mph to keep up with traffic
No faster than 65 mph
Faster than 70 mph

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true about merging onto an expressway?
choices: Always turn your head to look quickly to the side before changing lanes (merging)
Drive faster than the expressway traffic to find a gap
Merge onto the expressway as quickly as possible, vehicles on the expressway must always yield the right-of-way

questions.question: You have given consent to take a test for determining the alcoholic level in your blood:
choices: Whenever you drive a motor vehicle in the state
Only if you have been drinking alcohol
Only if you have been involved in an accident

questions.question: A traffic signal with a yellow arrow means:
choices: The protected turning time period is ending
You must speed up to beat the red light
The same thing as a stop sign

questions.question: When you approach a railroad crossing without warning signals, stop signs, or crossing gates:
choices: Always stop
Keep speed and cross the tracks quickly
Slow down, look and be ready to stop

questions.question: You are over age 21. A law enforcement officer believes you have been driving under the influence. The officer wants to take a blood or breath test. What happens if you refuse?
choices: You will get a minimum jail sentence of 72 hours
You will be fined $500
Your license will be suspended for one year

questions.question: Which is one factor that significantly affects your stopping distance?
choices: Roadway conditions
Posted speed limit
Steering ability

questions.question: Before turning left, it is essential to:
choices: Yield to oncoming vehicles
Move to the right side of your lane
Sound your horn

questions.question: When you see a truck with an oversized load ahead of you, you should:
choices: Drive up as closely as possible, and then pass the truck
Keep normal distance and wait for the truck to make a turn or change lane
Avoid tailgating and allow extra room to the truck ahead

questions.question: When turning left at an intersection not controlled otherwise by signs or signals, you must:
choices: Proceed through the intersection even if there are vehicles coming straight through from the other direction
Yield the right-of-way to any vehicles coming straight through from the other direction
Alert any vehicles coming straight through from the other direction and make sure they stop

questions.question: If a yellow center line is solid on your side of the road, it means:
choices: Pass carefully
Do not pass
Slow down

questions.question: Which is true about large trucks?
choices: They have shorter stopping distances than most cars
They have smaller blind spots than most cars
They need more room to maneuver

questions.question: On which side should you pass this panel?
choices: To the right
To the left
On no side.

questions.question: What should you do if you approach a fire scene and there is an unprotected fire hose on the road?
choices: Cross the hose if it is not in use
Stop or drive around the hose
Cross the hose at 15 mph or less

questions.question: When parking close to a stop sign, you must keep what distance?
choices: 10 feet or more
More than 30 feet
At least 50 feet

questions.question: If you have extreme trouble seeing the road ahead due to weather conditions, you need to:
choices: Pull far off the roadway
Turn on your parking lights
Use your horn

questions.question: True or false? When passing another vehicle, a driver should wait until the other car is entirely visible in the rear-view mirror before turning back into the right-hand lane.
choices: True
False

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted, what is the legal speed limit in school zones?
choices: 35 mph
20 mph
15 mph

questions.question: You must always use headlights when:
choices: You approach a work zone
You use your windshield wipers
You stop on the road shoulder

questions.question: A person can be convicted of Driving Under the Influence (DUI) when the BAC is less than .08 percent but the driving ability is impaired.
choices: True
False

questions.question: A car passenger that is less than two years old must:
choices: Wear a safety belt if riding in the front seat
Be secured in a child passenger safety seat
Always ride in the back seat

questions.question: When brakes fail:
choices: Apply your parking brake cautiously
Steer off the road
Swing from one side of the road to the other to reduce speed

questions.question: Motorcycles need longer stopping distances than a car.
choices: True
False

questions.question: Always look carefully for motorcycles before you turn at an intersection because:
choices: Their small size and vulnerability in a crash
They don't stop at intersections
They always have the right-of-way at intersections

questions.question: You are driving on a four-lane highway. From which lane should you make a right turn?
choices: The lane closest to the right edge
Any lane if the cross street also has four lanes
Any of the two lanes to your right

questions.question: There is a large truck ahead of you. It signals a right turn. What is the main reason for you to stay back and not pass the truck?
choices: The truck might have to swing wide to complete the turn
Truck drivers often change their minds
The turn signals may not work properly

questions.question: Which is one factor that significantly affects your stopping distance?
choices: Type and condition of tires
Type of safety belts
Type of airbags

questions.question: Which is true about alcohol?
choices: It improves your reaction time
It is the number one killer on American roadways
It helps you stay awake and active

questions.question: What do you use the three-second rule for?
choices: Making sure there is enough room behind your vehicle
Keeping a safe gap between you and the car ahead
Calculating your speed in bad weather

questions.question: When driving near a pedestrian who is carrying a white cane or using a guide dog, you should:
choices: Proceed normally
Slow down and be prepared to stop
Honk your horn

questions.question: When can you pass a stopped school bus on your side of the roadway?
choices: If red lights are flashing, but no children are present
You are never allowed to pass
If you are signaled by a uniformed adult school crossing guard to proceed

questions.question: If there is an oncoming vehicle in your lane, you should:
choices: Go to the left, if this area is free of traffic
Brake hard and look for an escape route on the right edge of the road
Tap the horn and steer straight ahead until the other driver returns to the proper lane

questions.question: Where is passing another vehicle on two-lane, two-way roads not allowed?
choices: On one-way streets
On roads without center lines
Within 100 feet of a railroad crossing

questions.question: When can you use a cell phone without a hands-free device while driving?
choices: When temporarily stopped at a red light
When driving slower than the speed limit
When making a call for emergency assistance

questions.question: When you move to Illinois and have a valid license from another state, you must get a driver's license from Illinois within:
choices: 21 days
14 days
90 days

questions.question: When driving on a slippery surface such as snow or ice, you should:
choices: Use your parking lights so you do not blind other drivers
Use low gears to keep traction, especially on hills
Allow less space than usual between you and the car in front of you

questions.question: When you approach a traffic signal displaying a steady yellow light, your best action would be to:
choices: Be prepared to stop before the intersection
Speed up and enter the intersection before the light turns red
Proceed through the intersection at an exceptionally low speed

questions.question: Your car must have a horn that others can hear from a distance of:
choices: A horn is not a required equipment
At least 200 feet
At least 100 feet

questions.question: You park legally at a railroad crossing if you keep this distance from the nearest rail:
choices: 11 feet
51 feet
31 feet

questions.question: Always stop before you cross railroad tracks if:
choices: You have young children in the car
You cannot cross and clear the tracks
There are more than two tracks

questions.question: Which pavement marking separates lanes with traffic going in the same direction?
choices: Yellow broken lines
White lines
Solid yellow lines
